algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: Sort intervals by start point, then by end point descending. Iterate and pick points to satisfy intervals.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest set of numbers that intersects each interval at least twice.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy strategy sorts intervals and iteratively selects points to cover intervals, prioritizing those ending earliest.
time_complexity: O(n log n) due to sorting
space_complexity: O(n) for storing sorted intervals and counts
key_insights: Sorting intervals by their start points is crucial for a greedy approach.
When considering an interval, it's best to pick points that also cover subsequent intervals.
The greedy choice involves picking the two largest possible numbers within an interval that haven't been picked yet, to maximize their utility for future intervals.
